name: k6-zap-perfsec-automation
description: Production-ready Performance (k6) + Security (OWASP ZAP) Testing Framework

scripts.k6:load: docker run --rm -i grafana/k6 run --out json=k6-load-results.json - < k6/load.js
scripts.k6:stress: docker run --rm -i grafana/k6 run --out json=k6-stress-results.json - < k6/stress.js
scripts.k6:all: npm run k6:smoke && npm run k6:load && npm run k6:stress
scripts.zap:scan: docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/zap/wrk:rw -t zaproxy/zap-stable zap-baseline.py -t https://testphp.vulnweb.com -r zap-report.html -c zap/zap-baseline.conf
scripts.zap:scan-quick: docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/zap/wrk:rw -t zaproxy/zap-stable zap-baseline.py -t https://testphp.vulnweb.com -r zap-report.html -m 2
scripts.test:all: npm run k6:all && npm run zap:scan
scripts.docker:pull: docker pull grafana/k6 && docker pull zaproxy/zap-stable
scripts.help:
echo 'Available commands:
  k6:smoke       - Quick API health check (30s)
  k6:load        - Realistic load test (6m)
  k6:stress      - Find breaking points (10m)
  k6:all         - Run all k6 tests
  zap:scan       - Security vulnerability scan (2-5m)
  zap:scan-quick - Quick ZAP scan (2m max)
  test:perf      - Run performance tests
  test:sec       - Run security tests
  test:all       - Run ALL tests (perf + sec)
  docker:pull    - Download latest k6 and ZAP images
  clean          - Remove generated test reports'
